title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: Soft, moist muffins made without eggs or dairy.
ingredients: ½ cup mixed white & brown sugar
⅓ cup neutral oil & apple sauce
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour and baking powder and set aside.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Fold in chocolate chips.
Fill muffin tins to the top, sprinkle extra chips, and bake for 20 mins.

title: Double Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy and chocolatey vegan cookies with a rich cocoa base.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp espresso powder (optional, but highly recommended)
1/3 cup (83 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup vegan chocolate chips or chopped vegan chocolate
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder.
In a separate bowl, cream the softened vegan butter with applesauce, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet, mixing until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips or chunks.
Scoop cookie dough onto the baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.
Let cookies cool for 5 minutes on the tray before transferring to a wire rack.

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies made gluten-free with oat flour and dairy-free yogurt.
ingredients: 1/2 cup (113 g) salted vegan butter, room temperature
1 cup (180 g) vegan chocolate chips or vegan milk chocolate chunks
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together oat flour, arrowroot starch, baking powder, and baking soda.
In a separate bowl, cream together the softened vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Stir in the dairy-free yogurt and vanilla extract until combined.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough.
Fold in chocolate chips or chunks.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes or until edges are golden.
Allow to cool for 5–10 minutes before serving.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups (280 g) all purpose flour or gluten free 1:1 baking flour, sifted and spoon & leveled
2/3 cup (150 g) salted vegan butter, softened
1/3 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips (semi-sweet or your choice!)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Funfetti Sugar Cookies
description: Chewy in the middle, crispy on the outside, fun sugar cookies!
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch, salt, sprinkles
Cream the butter, sugar, applesauce, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Fold in more sprinkles
Roll the dough into desired balls, and bake for around 10-15 mins depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Ginger Snap Cookies
description: Chewy in the middle, crispy on the outside, fun ginger cookies!
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Cream the butter, sugar, molasses, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Roll the dough into desired balls in the white sugar, and bake for around 10-15 mins depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Linzer Tart Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour and almond meal together, set aside.
Cream the butter, sugar, salt, lemon-zest, yogurt, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Roll the dough to 1/8 thickness and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Begin to cut shapes, haolf of the shapes plain and half of them with a shape cut out in the center. Bake for about 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
Once cookies are cooled, add the jam to the center, sandwich the cookie, and dust with powdered sugar!

title: S'mores Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour, salt, baking soda, and set aside.
Cream the butter, sugar, yogurt/applesauce, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Fold in the chocolate chips and graham crackers
Roll the dough into desired balls, make a cavity in the middle, and place marshmallow. Bake for around 10-15 mins depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Valentines Day Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and set aside.
Mix the oil/butter, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Roll the dough and cut into shapes. Bake for around 10-12 minutes until golden brown. Add icing if desired!

title: Iced Lemon Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups (280 g) all purpose flour or gluten free 1:1 baking flour, sifted and spoon & leveled
2/3 cup (150 g) salted vegan butter, softened
1/3 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips (semi-sweet or your choice!)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Iced Oatmeal Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (180 g) all purpose flour or gluten free 1:1 baking flour, sifted and spoon & leveled
1/2 cup (113 g) salted vegan butter, melted
1/4 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
Let chill for 30 minutes.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.
